decisions.what: Move away from purely e-commerce carousel approach to more creative, lifestyle-oriented imagery for PDP
decisions.context: Current design feels too functional (like Wayfair) and not lifestyle-oriented enough; should be more like Apple's approach

decisions.what: Be bolder with VMS design and use it as an opportunity to try new things
decisions.context: VMS doesn't have the same restrictions as TPT and Good Shop, providing a window of opportunity for experimentation

decisions.what: Integrate images more seamlessly with white background blending into page, add more visible controls, close-up images, and video content
decisions.context: To create a more engaging and lifestyle-focused product page experience

feedback: Nikita challenged Hamed's constraint-focused mindset, encouraging him to be bolder and more ambitious with design ideas despite technical limitations
Nikita acknowledged being happy with TPT design but less satisfied with Good Shop design outcomes

blockers.issue: Technical constraints and feasibility concerns limiting design ambition (replicating advanced designs could take at least half a year)
Lack of image consistency across product detail pages

key_topics: Above-the-fold visibility for subscribe and save (SNS) and one-time purchase (OTP)
Early engineer involvement in creative process

decisions.what: Push OTP full launch to Monday of week two instead of week 51
decisions.context: Mitigate risks associated with limited team bandwidth, outstanding items in week 51, and proximity to year-end dates. Week one would still see low traffic due to calendar year.

decisions.what: Do a full launch rather than a soft launch for OTP
decisions.context: Recommended by Nikita to reduce complexity and risk given the timing

decisions.what: Implement Shopify redirects to prevent multiple accounts across websites
decisions.context: Decision by Samir and Allison. Net new users from legacy pages redirected to Shopify; existing Factor account users landing on Shopify redirected back to legacy page to see their subscriptions and past orders. Expected to affect only small percentage (5% or less) of users.

decisions.what: Keep current Shopify redirect setup as is
decisions.context: Agreed by Nikita since it won't impact too many people overall, with tracking in place to monitor if alternative solution needed

feedback: Nikita thanked Hamed for being super quick on the roadmap stuff, noting the workshop yesterday went really well

blockers.issue: Broken link to full-functioning mobile app prototype

decisions.what: Focus on CVA impact rather than strict OKR numerical accuracy, accepting variance of ±25-50%
decisions.context: OKR tracking discussion where Nikita emphasized impact over precision

decisions.what: Use micro conversions for small, high-confidence experiments; reserve actual conversion/revenue data for critical experiments
decisions.context: Addressing the 6-8 week time to significance problem in experimentation

decisions.what: Focus on overall business numbers (net revenue, AOU, weekly active users) and make assumptions about metric correlations
decisions.context: Simplifying the connection between micro conversions and business outcomes

decisions.what: If hired, Tishia would be dedicated to TPT, Good Job, and VMS
decisions.context: Staffing allocation discussion

blockers.issue: Long time to significance for experiments (6-8 weeks), causing delays in experimentation velocity
Implementing micro conversions requires more PA support to set up new metrics in static, which hasn't been done before
Expected pushback on using micro conversions approach; not applicable for all experiment types (e.g., price testing)
Need for analyst support to translate micro conversion impact to key metrics like CVR

key_topics: Experimentation methodology and time to significance
Business metrics and north star KPIs
